cards.name: Dark Nourishment
cards.text: Dark Nourishment deals 3 damage to any target. You gain 3 life.
cards.flavor: Demons lurk in the shadows of ancient ruins, spreading plague and corruption across the land.

rulings.text: If the target permanent or player is an illegal target by the time Dark Nourishment resolves, the entire spell doesn't resolve. You won't gain life.

cards.originalText: Dark Nourishment deals 3 damage to target creature or player. You gain 3 life.

cards.name: Deadeye Tormentor
cards.text: Raid — When Deadeye Tormentor enters the battlefield, if you attacked with a creature this turn, target opponent discards a card.
cards.flavor: Despite their noble heritage, the pirates of the Deadeye Fleet are known for underhanded tactics and despicable trickery.

rulings.text: Raid abilities care only that you attacked with a creature. It doesn't matter how many creatures you attacked with, or which opponent or planeswalker controlled by an opponent those creatures attacked.

Raid abilities evaluate the entire turn to see if you attacked with a creature. That creature doesn't have to still be on the battlefield. Similarly, the player or planeswalker it attacked doesn't have to still be in the game or on the battlefield, respectively.

cards.originalText: Raid — When Deadeye Tormentor enters the battlefield, if you attacked with a creature this turn, target opponent discards a card.

cards.name: Deadeye Tracker
cards.text: {1}{B}, {T}: Exile two target cards from an opponent's graveyard. Deadeye Tracker explores. (Reveal the top card of your library. Put that card into your hand if it's a land. Otherwise, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature, then put the card back or put it into your graveyard.)

rulings.text: You can't activate Deadeye Tracker's ability without targeting two cards in a single opponent's graveyard.
If one target card is an illegal target by the time Deadeye Tracker's ability resolves, the remaining legal target is exiled and Deadeye Tracker explores.
If each target card is an illegal target by the time Deadeye Tracker's ability resolves, the entire ability doesn't resolve. Deadeye Tracker won't explore.

Once an ability that causes a creature to explore begins to resolve, no player may take any other actions until it's done. Notably, opponents can't try to remove the exploring creature after you reveal a nonland card but before it receives a counter.
If no card is revealed, most likely because that player's library is empty, the exploring creature receives a +1/+1 counter.

If a resolving spell or ability instructs a specific creature to explore but that creature has left the battlefield, the creature still explores. If you reveal a nonland card this way, you won't put a +1/+1 counter on anything, but you may put the revealed card into your graveyard. Effects that trigger "whenever a creature you control explores" trigger if appropriate.

cards.originalText: {1}{B}, {T}: Exile two target cards from an opponent's graveyard. Deadeye Tracker explores. (Reveal the top card of your library. Put that card into your hand if it's a land. Otherwise, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature, then put the card back or put it into your graveyard.)

cards.name: Deathless Ancient
cards.text:
Flying
Tap three untapped Vampires you control: Return Deathless Ancient from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: "Ancient one, we have reached the promised shore. The Immortal Sun is near. Drink and awake."

rulings.text: Deathless Ancient's last ability can be activated only while it's in your graveyard.

Once you announce that you're activating Deathless Ancient's last ability, no player may take other actions until the ability's been paid for. Notably, players can't try to stop the ability by tapping or removing Vampires you control.

To activate the last ability, you may tap any untapped Vampires you control, including ones you haven't controlled continuously since the beginning of your most recent turn. (Note that tapping the creature doesn't use {T} [the tap symbol].)

cards.originalText:
Flying
Tap three untapped Vampires you control: Return Deathless Ancient from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Desperate Castaways
cards.text: Desperate Castaways can't attack unless you control an artifact.
cards.flavor: A pirate crew without a ship is a crew that will do anything to get one.

rulings.text: Once Desperate Castaways has attacked, it will remain in combat even if you no longer control an artifact.

cards.originalText: Desperate Castaways can't attack unless you control an artifact.

cards.name: Dire Fleet Hoarder
cards.text: When Dire Fleet Hoarder dies, create a colorless Treasure artifact token with "{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color."
cards.flavor: Among the pirates of the Brazen Coalition, the only thing more dangerous than failure is success.

foreignNames.name: 凶兆艦隊の貯め込み屋

cards.originalText: When Dire Fleet Hoarder dies, create a colorless Treasure artifact token with "{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool."

cards.name: Dire Fleet Interloper
cards.text:
Menace
When Dire Fleet Interloper enters the battlefield, it explores. (Reveal the top card of your library. Put that card into your hand if it's a land. Otherwise, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature, then put the card back or put it into your graveyard.)

rulings.text: Once an ability that causes a creature to explore begins to resolve, no player may take any other actions until it's done. Notably, opponents can't try to remove the exploring creature after you reveal a nonland card but before it receives a counter.
If no card is revealed, most likely because that player's library is empty, the exploring creature receives a +1/+1 counter.

If a resolving spell or ability instructs a specific creature to explore but that creature has left the battlefield, the creature still explores. If you reveal a nonland card this way, you won't put a +1/+1 counter on anything, but you may put the revealed card into your graveyard. Effects that trigger "whenever a creature you control explores" trigger if appropriate.

cards.originalText:
Menace
When Dire Fleet Interloper enters the battlefield, it explores. (Reveal the top card of your library. Put that card into your hand if it's a land. Otherwise, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature, then put the card back or put it into your graveyard.)

cards.name: Dire Fleet Ravager
cards.text:
Menace, deathtouch
When Dire Fleet Ravager enters the battlefield, each player loses a third of their life, rounded up.
cards.flavor: His fists fume with the decay of death, each strike a plague on the hearts of his enemies.

rulings.text: For example, if you have 13 life, you'll lose 5 life.
If a player has 1 life, that player loses 1 life. If each player has 0 life after that, the game's a draw.
In a Two-Headed Giant game, each player loses a third of the team's life total rounded up. For example, if a team has 13 life, each player on that team loses 5 life and the team loses 10 life total.

cards.originalText:
Menace, deathtouch
When Dire Fleet Ravager enters the battlefield, each player loses a third of his or her life, rounded up.

cards.name: Duress
cards.text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a noncreature, nonland card from it. That player discards that card.
cards.flavor: Solitude and starvation are brutal punishments, but even worse is all that time to think.
cards.originalText: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a noncreature, nonland card from it. That player discards that card.

cards.name: Fathom Fleet Captain
cards.text:
Menace
Whenever Fathom Fleet Captain attacks, if you control another nontoken Pirate, you may pay {2}. If you do, create a 2/2 black Pirate creature token with menace.
cards.flavor: "Join me, and take the world for yourself!"

rulings.text: While resolving Fathom Fleet Captain's triggered ability, you can't pay {2} multiple times to create more than one Pirate token.

If you don't control another nontoken Pirate at the moment Fathom Fleet Captain attacks, its triggered ability won't trigger. If you don't control another nontoken Pirate as that ability resolves, you can't pay {2}.

foreignNames.name: Capitaine de la Flotte des grands fonds

cards.originalText:
Menace
Whenever Fathom Fleet Captain attacks, if you control another nontoken Pirate, you may pay {2}. If you do, create a 2/2 black Pirate creature token with menace.

cards.name: Fathom Fleet Cutthroat
cards.text: When Fathom Fleet Cutthroat enters the battlefield, destroy target creature an opponent controls that was dealt damage this turn.
cards.flavor: "It was a bad evening for you, mate. Now it's chow time for the sharks."

foreignNames.name: Surineuse de la Flotte des grands fonds

cards.originalText: When Fathom Fleet Cutthroat enters the battlefield, destroy target creature an opponent controls that was dealt damage this turn.

cards.name: Grim Captain's Call
cards.text: Return a Pirate card from your graveyard to your hand, then do the same for Vampire, Dinosaur, and Merfolk.
cards.flavor: When the battle is over, the bitterest foes at last find common ground.

rulings.text: Grim Captain's Call doesn't target the cards to return. You choose them while it's resolving. No players may take actions between the time you make each choice and the time you return each card to your hand.

If a card in your graveyard has more than one of these types (such as a Dinosaur that's a Vampire Dinosaur due to Arcane Adaptation's effect), you may choose to return it for one of its types and return another card of the other type.
If you don't have a card in your graveyard of one of the listed creature types, you just continue to the next listed type.

If an effect refers to a "[subtype] spell" or "[subtype] card," it refers only to a spell or card that has that subtype. For example, March of the Drowned is a card that benefits Pirates and features Pirates in its illustration, but it isn't a Pirate card.

cards.originalText: Return a Pirate card from your graveyard to your hand, then do the same for Vampire, Dinosaur, and Merfolk.

cards.name: Heartless Pillage
cards.text:
Target opponent discards two cards.
Raid — If you attacked with a creature this turn, create a colorless Treasure artifact token with "{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color."

rulings.text: If you've attacked with a creature this turn, you'll get a Treasure even if the target opponent discards one or zero cards.

Raid abilities care only that you attacked with a creature. It doesn't matter how many creatures you attacked with, or which opponent or planeswalker controlled by an opponent those creatures attacked.

Raid abilities evaluate the entire turn to see if you attacked with a creature. That creature doesn't have to still be on the battlefield. Similarly, the player or planeswalker it attacked doesn't have to still be in the game or on the battlefield, respectively.

cards.originalText:
Target opponent discards two cards.
Raid — If you attacked with a creature this turn, create a colorless Treasure artifact token with "{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool."

cards.name: Kitesail Freebooter
cards.text:
Flying
When Kitesail Freebooter enters the battlefield, target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a noncreature, nonland card from it. Exile that card until Kitesail Freebooter leaves the battlefield.

rulings.text: If Kitesail Freebooter leaves the battlefield before its enters-the-battlefield ability resolves, the opponent will reveal their hand, but no card will be exiled.
The exiled card returns to its owner's hand immediately after Kitesail Freebooter leaves the battlefield. Nothing happens between the two events, including state-based actions.

In a multiplayer game, if Kitesail Freebooter's owner leaves the game, the exiled card will return to its owner's hand. Because the one-shot effect that returns the card isn't an ability that goes on the stack, it won't cease to exist along with the leaving player's spells and abilities on the stack.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Kitesail Freebooter enters the battlefield, target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a noncreature, nonland card from it. Exile that card until Kitesail Freebooter leaves the battlefield.

cards.name: Lurking Chupacabra
cards.text: Whenever a creature you control explores, target creature an opponent controls gets -2/-2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Shadow birthed it. The moon gave it eyes, and the jungle gave it teeth. But it was Death that taught it cruelty."
—Huatli

rulings.text: You don't choose a target for Lurking Chupacabra's ability until after your creature has finished exploring.

If a resolving spell or ability instructs a specific creature to explore but that creature has left the battlefield, the creature still explores. Effects that trigger when a creature you control explores, such as that of Lurking Chupacabra, trigger if appropriate.

foreignNames.name: 隠れ潜むチュパカブラ

cards.originalText: Whenever a creature you control explores, target creature an opponent controls gets -2/-2 until end of turn.

cards.name: March of the Drowned
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
• Return two target Pirate cards from your graveyard to your hand.

rulings.text: If an effect refers to a "[subtype] spell" or "[subtype] card," it refers only to a spell or card that has that subtype. For example, March of the Drowned is a card that benefits Pirates and features Pirates in its illustration, but it isn't a Pirate card.

cards.originalText:
Choose one —
• Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
• Return two target Pirate cards from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Mark of the Vampire
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has lifelink.
cards.flavor:
"Through your sacrifice of self, you become holy. Through your strength, all will be saved."
—From the Rite of Redemption

rulings.text: Multiple instances of lifelink on the same creature are redundant.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has lifelink.

cards.name: Queen's Agent
cards.text:
Lifelink
When Queen's Agent enters the battlefield, it explores. (Reveal the top card of your library. Put that card into your hand if it's a land. Otherwise, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature, then put the card back or put it into your graveyard.)

rulings.text: Once an ability that causes a creature to explore begins to resolve, no player may take any other actions until it's done. Notably, opponents can't try to remove the exploring creature after you reveal a nonland card but before it receives a counter.
If no card is revealed, most likely because that player's library is empty, the exploring creature receives a +1/+1 counter.

If a resolving spell or ability instructs a specific creature to explore but that creature has left the battlefield, the creature still explores. If you reveal a nonland card this way, you won't put a +1/+1 counter on anything, but you may put the revealed card into your graveyard. Effects that trigger "whenever a creature you control explores" trigger if appropriate.

cards.originalText:
Lifelink
When Queen's Agent enters the battlefield, it explores. (Reveal the top card of your library. Put that card into your hand if it's a land. Otherwise, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature, then put the card back or put it into your graveyard.)

cards.name: Queen's Bay Soldier
cards.flavor: The soldiers of the Legion of Dusk have come to the colonies at Queen's Bay in search of glory and riches. They are veterans of centuries of warfare, and they thirst for conquest.

foreignNames.name: Soldatin aus der Bucht der Königin
Soldate de la Baie de la reine
Soldado de Bahía de la Reina

cards.name: Raiders' Wake
cards.text:
Whenever an opponent discards a card, that player loses 2 life.
Raid — At the beginning of your end step, if you attacked with a creature this turn, target opponent discards a card.
cards.flavor: One was spared to tell the gruesome tale.

rulings.text: Raid abilities care only that you attacked with a creature. It doesn't matter how many creatures you attacked with, or which opponent or planeswalker controlled by an opponent those creatures attacked.

Raid abilities evaluate the entire turn to see if you attacked with a creature. That creature doesn't have to still be on the battlefield. Similarly, the player or planeswalker it attacked doesn't have to still be in the game or on the battlefield, respectively.

Some raid abilities trigger at the beginning of your end step. These abilities trigger if you attacked with a creature that turn, even if the card with that raid ability wasn't on the battlefield when you attacked.

cards.originalText:
Whenever an opponent discards a card, that player loses 2 life.
Raid — At the beginning of your end step, if you attacked with a creature this turn, target opponent discards a card.

cards.name: Revel in Riches
cards.text:
Whenever a creature an opponent controls dies, create a colorless Treasure artifact token with "{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color."
At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control ten or more Treasures, you win the game.

rulings.text: If you don't control ten Treasures as your upkeep begins, the second ability of Revel in Riches won't trigger. You can't take any actions during your turn before your upkeep begins.
If you don't control ten Treasures as the second ability of Revel in Riches resolves, you won't win the game.
If an opponent's creature dies at the same time that Revel in Riches is destroyed, you'll get a Treasure.
If the second ability of Revel in Riches causes you to win the game, please refrain from throwing your Treasure tokens into the air as this may distract or injure other players.

cards.originalText:
Whenever a creature an opponent controls dies, create a colorless Treasure artifact token with "{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool."
At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control ten or more Treasures, you win the game.

cards.name: Ruin Raider
cards.text: Raid — At the beginning of your end step, if you attacked with a creature this turn, reveal the top card of your library and put that card into your hand. You lose life equal to the card's converted mana cost.

rulings.text: If the mana cost of the revealed card includes {X}, X is considered to be 0.
If the revealed card doesn't have a mana cost (because it's a land card, for example), its converted mana cost is 0.
The converted mana cost of a split card, such as cards with aftermath from the Amonkhet block, is based on the combined mana cost of its two halves.

Raid abilities care only that you attacked with a creature. It doesn't matter how many creatures you attacked with, or which opponent or planeswalker controlled by an opponent those creatures attacked.

Raid abilities evaluate the entire turn to see if you attacked with a creature. That creature doesn't have to still be on the battlefield. Similarly, the player or planeswalker it attacked doesn't have to still be in the game or on the battlefield, respectively.

Some raid abilities trigger at the beginning of your end step. These abilities trigger if you attacked with a creature that turn, even if the card with that raid ability wasn't on the battlefield when you attacked.

cards.originalText: Raid — At the beginning of your end step, if you attacked with a creature this turn, reveal the top card of your library and put that card into your hand. You lose life equal to the card's converted mana cost.

cards.name: Ruthless Knave
cards.text:
{2}{B}, Sacrifice a creature: Create two colorless Treasure artifact tokens with "{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color."
Sacrifice three Treasures: Draw a card.
cards.flavor: "This scum is barely worth the trouble."

rulings.text: You can sacrifice Ruthless Knave to pay the cost for its first ability.
The Treasures you sacrifice to activate Ruthless Knave's last ability can't also be sacrificed for mana.

cards.originalText:
{2}{B}, Sacrifice a creature: Create two colorless Treasure artifact tokens with "{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool."
Sacrifice three Treasures: Draw a card.

cards.name: Sanctum Seeker
cards.text: Whenever a Vampire you control attacks, each opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: The Sanctum Seekers were the first of the knightly orders to cross the sea and are still the most zealous.

rulings.text: In a Two-Headed Giant game, Sanctum Seeker's ability causes the opposing team to lose 2 life and you to gain 1 life.

cards.originalText: Whenever a Vampire you control attacks, each opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Seekers' Squire
cards.text: When Seekers' Squire enters the battlefield, it explores. (Reveal the top card of your library. Put that card into your hand if it's a land. Otherwise, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature, then put the card back or put it into your graveyard.)
cards.flavor: Dusk follows the light.

rulings.text: Once an ability that causes a creature to explore begins to resolve, no player may take any other actions until it's done. Notably, opponents can't try to remove the exploring creature after you reveal a nonland card but before it receives a counter.
If no card is revealed, most likely because that player's library is empty, the exploring creature receives a +1/+1 counter.

If a resolving spell or ability instructs a specific creature to explore but that creature has left the battlefield, the creature still explores. If you reveal a nonland card this way, you won't put a +1/+1 counter on anything, but you may put the revealed card into your graveyard. Effects that trigger "whenever a creature you control explores" trigger if appropriate.

cards.originalText: When Seekers' Squire enters the battlefield, it explores. (Reveal the top card of your library. Put that card into your hand if it's a land. Otherwise, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature, then put the card back or put it into your graveyard.)

cards.name: Skittering Heartstopper
cards.text: {B}: Skittering Heartstopper gains deathtouch until end of turn.
cards.flavor: It flows like water over the forest floor, as deadly as the swiftest current.
cards.originalText: {B}: Skittering Heartstopper gains deathtouch until end of turn.

cards.name: Skulduggery
cards.text: Until end of turn, target creature you control gets +1/+1 and target creature an opponent controls gets -1/-1.
cards.flavor: "They're so much more willing to parley once they're hanging from a boom by the ankle!"

rulings.text: You can't cast Skulduggery unless you choose both a creature you control and a creature you don't control as targets.
If either target becomes illegal after you cast Skulduggery but before it resolves, the other is still affected as appropriate.

cards.originalText: Until end of turn, target creature you control gets +1/+1 and target creature an opponent controls gets -1/-1.

cards.name: Skymarch Bloodletter
cards.text:
Flying
When Skymarch Bloodletter enters the battlefield, target opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: From the perpetual shadowsmoke that hung above the ship, a silent form emerged, lips curled with malice and anticipation.
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Skymarch Bloodletter enters the battlefield, target opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Spreading Rot
cards.text: Destroy target land. Its controller loses 2 life.
cards.flavor:
"What is this foul presence that defies the sun's cleansing rays?"
—Itzama the Crested
cards.originalText: Destroy target land. Its controller loses 2 life.

cards.name: Sword-Point Diplomacy
cards.text: Reveal the top three cards of your library. For each of those cards, put that card into your hand unless any opponent pays 3 life. Then exile the rest.
cards.flavor: "Take my blood if you want. Just don't take my gold!"

rulings.text: You reveal all three cards before opponents choose whether to pay life for any of them.

In a multiplayer game, each opponent in turn order chooses whether to pay life for one card before proceeding to the next card. You choose the order to perform this process for the cards, but opponents may discuss them before making any choices. Opponents will then know choices made by earlier opponents when making their choices.

cards.originalText: Reveal the top three cards of your library. For each of those cards, put that card into your hand unless any opponent pays 3 life. Then exile the rest.

cards.name: Vanquish the Weak
cards.text: Destroy target creature with power 3 or less.
cards.flavor: The clerics known as condemners punish those who do not recognize the righteous authority of the church.
cards.originalText: Destroy target creature with power 3 or less.

cards.name: Vicious Conquistador
cards.text: Whenever Vicious Conquistador attacks, each opponent loses 1 life.
cards.flavor:
"He is ambitious. Tireless. And utterly ruthless. Ideal for the frontier."
—Viceroy Elia Sotonores, report to the queen
cards.originalText: Whenever Vicious Conquistador attacks, each opponent loses 1 life.

cards.name: Vraska's Contempt
cards.text: Exile target creature or planeswalker. You gain 2 life.
cards.flavor: It wasn't long before the taverns of High and Dry were full of whispers about the new captain who could turn a person to stone with a glance.

rulings.text: If the target creature or planeswalker is an illegal target by the time Vraska's Contempt resolves, the entire spell doesn't resolve. You won't gain life.

There are many important moments in the story, but the most crucial—called "story spotlights"—are shown on cards. These cards have the Planeswalker symbol in their text box; this symbol has no effect on gameplay. You can read more about these events in the official Magic fiction at http://www.mtgstory.com.

cards.originalText: Exile target creature or planeswalker. You gain 2 life.

cards.name: Walk the Plank
cards.text: Destroy target non-Merfolk creature.
cards.flavor: When Captain Thorn adds a new ship to his fleet, he gives the crew a simple choice: follow me, or fall in the sea.
cards.originalText: Destroy target non-Merfolk creature.

cards.name: Wanted Scoundrels
cards.text: When Wanted Scoundrels dies, target opponent creates two colorless Treasure artifact tokens with "{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color."
cards.flavor: "Trust me. The reward's not worth it."
cards.originalText: When Wanted Scoundrels dies, target opponent creates two colorless Treasure artifact tokens with "{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool."

cards.name: Angrath's Marauders
cards.text: If a source you control would deal damage to a permanent or player, it deals double that damage to that permanent or player instead.
cards.flavor: Captain Angrath cares less about treasure than mayhem. If he can't leave Ixalan, he'll burn the plane down.

rulings.text: If a creature with trample you control would deal combat damage to a blocking creature while you control Angrath's Marauders, you must assign its unmodified damage. For example, a 3/3 creature with trample blocked by a 2/2 creature can have at most 1 damage assigned to the defending player. It will then deal 4 damage to the blocking creature and 2 damage to the defending player.
If an effect such as that of Chandra's Pyrohelix asks you to divide damage among targets, you must divide the unmodified damage before doubling it.
If you control a second Angrath's Marauders, damage dealt by sources you control will be multiplied by 4. If you control a third, it will be multiplied by 8, and so on.

cards.originalText: If a source you control would deal damage to a permanent or player, it deals double that damage to that permanent or player instead.

cards.name: Bonded Horncrest
cards.text: Bonded Horncrest can't attack or block alone.
cards.flavor:
"You don't tame a horncrest. You convince it that it's easier to destroy something else."
—Amautl, knight of Atzocan

rulings.text: If you control more than one Bonded Horncrest, they can attack or block together, even if no other creatures attack or block.

Although Bonded Horncrest can't attack alone, other attacking creatures don't have to attack the same player or planeswalker. For example, Bonded Horncrest could attack an opponent and another creature could attack a planeswalker that opponent controls. Similarly, other blocking creatures don't have to block the same creature that Bonded Horncrest blocks.
Once Bonded Horncrest has attacked or blocked, it will remain in combat even if you no longer control another attacking or blocking creature.
If an effect says that Bonded Horncrest attacks or blocks if able and you control another creature able to attack or block, you must attack or block with Bonded Horncrest and that creature.
In a Two-Headed Giant game, Bonded Horncrest can attack or block with a creature controlled by your teammate, even if no other creatures you control are attacking or blocking.

cards.originalText: Bonded Horncrest can't attack or block alone.

cards.name: Brazen Buccaneers
cards.text:
Haste
When Brazen Buccaneers enters the battlefield, it explores. (Reveal the top card of your library. Put that card into your hand if it's a land. Otherwise, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature, then put the card back or put it into your graveyard.)

rulings.text: Once an ability that causes a creature to explore begins to resolve, no player may take any other actions until it's done. Notably, opponents can't try to remove the exploring creature after you reveal a nonland card but before it receives a counter.
If no card is revealed, most likely because that player's library is empty, the exploring creature receives a +1/+1 counter.

If a resolving spell or ability instructs a specific creature to explore but that creature has left the battlefield, the creature still explores. If you reveal a nonland card this way, you won't put a +1/+1 counter on anything, but you may put the revealed card into your graveyard. Effects that trigger "whenever a creature you control explores" trigger if appropriate.

cards.originalText:
Haste
When Brazen Buccaneers enters the battlefield, it explores. (Reveal the top card of your library. Put that card into your hand if it's a land. Otherwise, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature, then put the card back or put it into your graveyard.)

cards.name: Burning Sun's Avatar
cards.text: When Burning Sun's Avatar enters the battlefield, it deals 3 damage to target opponent or planeswalker and 3 damage to up to one target creature.
cards.flavor:
"Tilonalli's searing rays carry the spark of life's eventual destruction as all light fades."
—Chitlati, Lightning Rider

rulings.text: The ability of Burning Sun's Avatar can target any creature, not just one controlled by the target opponent.
If the ability of Burning Sun's Avatar has two targets and one becomes illegal, the other will still be dealt damage.

cards.originalText: When Burning Sun's Avatar enters the battlefield, it deals 3 damage to target opponent and 3 damage to up to one target creature.

cards.name: Captain Lannery Storm
cards.text:
Haste
Whenever Captain Lannery Storm attacks, create a colorless Treasure artifact token with "{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color."
Whenever you sacrifice a Treasure, Captain Lannery Storm gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

rulings.text: You can activate the mana ability of a Treasure even if you have nothing to spend that mana on.
Captain Lannery Storm's last ability triggers whenever you sacrifice a Treasure for any reason, not just to activate a Treasure's mana ability.
If you sacrifice Treasures to cast Captain Lannery Storm, its last ability won't trigger for those Treasures.

cards.originalText:
Haste
Whenever Captain Lannery Storm attacks, create a colorless Treasure artifact token with "{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool."
Whenever you sacrifice a Treasure, Captain Lannery Storm gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Captivating Crew
cards.text: {3}{R}: Gain control of target creature an opponent controls until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
cards.flavor: "We sail. We plunder. Then we dance."

rulings.text: You can target and gain control of an untapped creature this way.

cards.originalText: {3}{R}: Gain control of target creature an opponent controls until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

cards.name: Charging Monstrosaur
cards.text: Trample, haste
cards.flavor: "I knew I should have stayed with the boat. Always stay with the boat!"

foreignNames.name: 突進するモンストロサウルス

cards.originalText: Trample, haste

cards.name: Demolish
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or land.
cards.flavor: What took months for human hands to carve took just seconds for the dinosaur's tail to ruin.
cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact or land.

cards.name: Dinosaur Stampede
cards.text: Attacking creatures get +2/+0 until end of turn. Dinosaurs you control gain trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor: If you're in the way of a ceratops charge and you're made of mere flesh and bone, then you're not really in the way.

rulings.text: In a Two-Headed Giant game, attacking creatures your teammate controls get +2/+0, but only Dinosaurs you control gain trample.

cards.originalText: Attacking creatures get +2/+0 until end of turn. Dinosaurs you control gain trample until end of turn.

cards.name: Dual Shot
cards.text: Dual Shot deals 1 damage to each of up to two target creatures.
cards.flavor: "Through me the rage of Tilonalli burns twice as bright."

rulings.text: You can't target the same creature twice to have Dual Shot deal 2 damage to it.

cards.originalText: Dual Shot deals 1 damage to each of up to two target creatures.

cards.name: Fathom Fleet Firebrand
cards.text: {1}{R}: Fathom Fleet Firebrand gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: As she charges into battle, her arcane tattoos stir and crawl like fiery serpents.

foreignNames.name: Brandon de la Flotte des grands fonds

cards.originalText: {1}{R}: Fathom Fleet Firebrand gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Fiery Cannonade
cards.text: Fiery Cannonade deals 2 damage to each non-Pirate creature.
cards.flavor: Wary of the ferocious dinosaurs, the Legion of Dusk built up the walls of their fort—just in time for the pirates to burn them down.
cards.originalText: Fiery Cannonade deals 2 damage to each non-Pirate creature.

cards.name: Fire Shrine Keeper
cards.text:
Menace
{7}{R}, {T}, Sacrifice Fire Shrine Keeper: It deals 3 damage to each of up to two target creatures.
cards.flavor: Though grimed with the dust of centuries, the ancient shrine was not unguarded.

rulings.text: You can't target the same creature twice to have Fire Shrine Keeper deal 6 damage to it.

cards.originalText:
Menace
{7}{R}, {T}, Sacrifice Fire Shrine Keeper: It deals 3 damage to each of up to two target creatures.

cards.name: Firecannon Blast
cards.text:
Firecannon Blast deals 3 damage to target creature.
Raid — Firecannon Blast deals 6 damage to that creature instead if you attacked with a creature this turn.
cards.flavor: Goblins' fearlessness and diminutive size make them the perfect cannoneers.

rulings.text: Raid abilities care only that you attacked with a creature. It doesn't matter how many creatures you attacked with, or which opponent or planeswalker controlled by an opponent those creatures attacked.

Raid abilities evaluate the entire turn to see if you attacked with a creature. That creature doesn't have to still be on the battlefield. Similarly, the player or planeswalker it attacked doesn't have to still be in the game or on the battlefield, respectively.

cards.originalText:
Firecannon Blast deals 3 damage to target creature.
Raid — Firecannon Blast deals 6 damage to that creature instead if you attacked with a creature this turn.

cards.name: Frenzied Raptor
cards.flavor: Sun Empire warriors are taught to emulate the fearless raptors that fling themselves against towers of horn and muscle a hundred times their size.

cards.name: Headstrong Brute
cards.text:
Headstrong Brute can't block.
Headstrong Brute has menace as long as you control another Pirate.
cards.flavor:
"Watch your backs, keep your blades at hand, and let the orc go first!"
—Captain Brandis Thorn
cards.originalText:
Headstrong Brute can't block.
Headstrong Brute has menace as long as you control another Pirate.

cards.name: Hijack
cards.text: Gain control of target artifact or creature until end of turn. Untap it. It gains haste until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Trapped on Ixalan, the Planeswalker Angrath is the only minotaur sailing the seas. No matter how many ships he captures, he cannot break free.

rulings.text: You can target and gain control of an untapped artifact or creature this way. You can also untap an artifact or creature you already control and give it haste.

cards.originalText: Gain control of target artifact or creature until end of turn. Untap it. It gains haste until end of turn.

cards.name: Lightning Strike
cards.text: Lightning Strike deals 3 damage to any target.
cards.flavor:
"Storm on the horizon, cap'n!"
—Grick Doobin, last words
cards.originalText: Lightning Strike deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Lightning-Rig Crew
cards.text:
{T}: Lightning-Rig Crew deals 1 damage to each opponent.
Whenever you cast a Pirate spell, untap Lightning-Rig Crew.
cards.flavor: A pirate ship in battle is a storm of activity.

rulings.text: Lightning-Rig Crew's second ability resolves before the spell that caused it to trigger. The ability will resolve even if that spell is countered.
In a Two-Headed Giant game, Lightning-Rig Crew's activated ability causes the opposing team to lose 2 life.

cards.originalText:
{T}: Lightning-Rig Crew deals 1 damage to each opponent.
Whenever you cast a Pirate spell, untap Lightning-Rig Crew.

cards.name: Makeshift Munitions
cards.text: {1}, Sacrifice an artifact or creature: Makeshift Munitions deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: "Grease up a firecannon good and proper with dinosaur-liver oil, and it'll shoot just about anything."

rulings.text: You can't sacrifice the same Treasure to pay both {1} and "sacrifice an artifact or creature."

cards.originalText: {1}, Sacrifice an artifact or creature: Makeshift Munitions deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Nest Robber
cards.text: Haste
cards.flavor:
"These sailors on our shores are like the dinosaurs that plunder eggs from nests. They live on the labors of others."
—Itzama the Crested
cards.originalText: Haste

cards.name: Otepec Huntmaster
cards.text:
Dinosaur spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
{T}: Target Dinosaur gains haste until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Forward! Let the Burning Sun's light guide you to deserving prey!"

rulings.text: To determine the total cost of a Dinosaur spell, start with the mana cost or alternative cost you're paying, add any cost increases, then apply any cost reductions. The converted mana cost of the creature remains unchanged, no matter what the total cost to cast it was.

If an effect refers to a "[subtype] spell" or "[subtype] card," it refers only to a spell or card that has that subtype. For example, March of the Drowned is a card that benefits Pirates and features Pirates in its illustration, but it isn't a Pirate card.

cards.originalText:
Dinosaur spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
{T}: Target Dinosaur gains haste until end of turn.

cards.name: Rampaging Ferocidon
cards.text:
Menace
Players can't gain life.
Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, Rampaging Ferocidon deals 1 damage to that creature's controller.
cards.flavor: All raptors are aggressive, but ferocidons seem to enjoy their prey's pain.

rulings.text: Spells and abilities that cause players to gain life still resolve while Rampaging Ferocidon is on the battlefield. No player will gain life, but any other effects of that spell or ability will happen.
If an effect says to set a player's life total to a number that's higher than the player's current life total while Rampaging Ferocidon is on the battlefield, the player's life total doesn't change.
Rampaging Ferocidon's last ability triggers whenever any player has a creature enter the battlefield, including you.
If another creature enters the battlefield at the same time as Rampaging Ferocidon, its last ability triggers.

foreignNames.name: 暴れ回るフェロキドン

cards.originalText:
Menace
Players can't gain life.
Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, Rampaging Ferocidon deals 1 damage to that creature's controller.

cards.name: Raptor Hatchling
cards.text: Enrage — Whenever Raptor Hatchling is dealt damage, create a 3/3 green Dinosaur creature token with trample.
cards.flavor:
"Every little hatchling has a parent's claws to guard it."
—Sun Empire saying

rulings.text: If multiple sources deal damage to a creature with an enrage ability at the same time, most likely because multiple creatures blocked that creature, the enrage ability triggers only once.

If lethal damage is dealt to a creature with an enrage ability, that ability triggers. The creature with that enrage ability leaves the battlefield before that ability resolves, so it won't be affected by the resolving ability.

cards.originalText: Enrage — Whenever Raptor Hatchling is dealt damage, create a 3/3 green Dinosaur creature token with trample.

cards.name: Repeating Barrage
cards.text:
Repeating Barrage deals 3 damage to any target.
Raid — {3}{R}{R}: Return Repeating Barrage from your graveyard to your hand. Activate this ability only if you attacked with a creature this turn.

rulings.text: Raid abilities care only that you attacked with a creature. It doesn't matter how many creatures you attacked with, or which opponent or planeswalker controlled by an opponent those creatures attacked.

Raid abilities evaluate the entire turn to see if you attacked with a creature. That creature doesn't have to still be on the battlefield. Similarly, the player or planeswalker it attacked doesn't have to still be in the game or on the battlefield, respectively.

cards.originalText:
Repeating Barrage deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
Raid — {3}{R}{R}: Return Repeating Barrage from your graveyard to your hand. Activate this ability only if you attacked with a creature this turn.

cards.name: Rigging Runner
cards.text:
First strike
Raid — Rigging Runner enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it if you attacked with a creature this turn.
cards.flavor: The hook makes him feel brave, and the hat makes him feel fancy.

rulings.text: Raid abilities care only that you attacked with a creature. It doesn't matter how many creatures you attacked with, or which opponent or planeswalker controlled by an opponent those creatures attacked.

Raid abilities evaluate the entire turn to see if you attacked with a creature. That creature doesn't have to still be on the battlefield. Similarly, the player or planeswalker it attacked doesn't have to still be in the game or on the battlefield, respectively.

cards.originalText:
First strike
Raid — Rigging Runner enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it if you attacked with a creature this turn.

cards.name: Rile
cards.text:
Rile deals 1 damage to target creature you control. That creature gains trample until end of turn.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: The enormous can still be at the mercy of the small.

rulings.text: If Rile targets a creature with 1 toughness, that creature won't be destroyed until after you've drawn a card. Its abilities may affect that draw or trigger on that draw if appropriate.
If the damage that would be dealt by Rile is prevented, the creature still gains trample until end of turn.
If the target creature is an illegal target by the time Rile resolves, the entire spell doesn't resolve. You won't draw a card.

cards.originalText:
Rile deals 1 damage to target creature you control. That creature gains trample until end of turn.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Rowdy Crew
cards.text:
Trample
When Rowdy Crew enters the battlefield, draw three cards, then discard two cards at random. If two cards that share a card type are discarded this way, put two +1/+1 counters on Rowdy Crew.

rulings.text: Once Rowdy Crew's triggered ability begins to resolve, no player may take other actions until it's done. Notably, you can't discard or cast any of the cards you draw to try to rig the results of the random discard.

The card types that can appear on the discarded cards are artifact, creature, enchantment, instant, land, planeswalker, sorcery, and tribal (a card type that appears on some older cards). Legendary is a supertype, not a card type.
The discarded cards just need to share one card type. For example, Rowdy Crew will get two +1/+1 counters if you discard an artifact creature and an enchantment creature.
Rowdy Crew doesn't get more than two +1/+1 counters if the discarded cards happen to share more than one card type.

cards.originalText:
Trample
When Rowdy Crew enters the battlefield, draw three cards, then discard two cards at random. If two cards that share a card type are discarded this way, put two +1/+1 counters on Rowdy Crew.

cards.name: Rummaging Goblin
cards.text: {T}, Discard a card: Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Goblins' eager curiosity leads them to scavenging, petty theft, and the rigging of sleek pirate ships. Some stop at scavenging.

rulings.text: Discarding a card is part of the cost to activate Rummaging Goblin's ability. If you don't have a card in your hand, you can't pay this part of the cost and you can't activate the ability.

cards.originalText: {T}, Discard a card: Draw a card.

cards.name: Star of Extinction
cards.text: Destroy target land. Star of Extinction deals 20 damage to each creature and each planeswalker.
cards.flavor:
"The visions haunt me. I see the end of the world, brought on by the search for the Immortal Sun."
—Shaper Pashona
cards.originalText: Destroy target land. Star of Extinction deals 20 damage to each creature and each planeswalker.

cards.name: Storm Fleet Arsonist
cards.text: Raid — When Storm Fleet Arsonist enters the battlefield, if you attacked with a creature this turn, target opponent sacrifices a permanent.
cards.flavor: "Go ahead, build another. I'll burn that down as well."

rulings.text: Raid abilities care only that you attacked with a creature. It doesn't matter how many creatures you attacked with, or which opponent or planeswalker controlled by an opponent those creatures attacked.

Raid abilities evaluate the entire turn to see if you attacked with a creature. That creature doesn't have to still be on the battlefield. Similarly, the player or planeswalker it attacked doesn't have to still be in the game or on the battlefield, respectively.

foreignNames.name: Incendiaire de la Flotte de la tempête

cards.originalText: Raid — When Storm Fleet Arsonist enters the battlefield, if you attacked with a creature this turn, target opponent sacrifices a permanent.

cards.name: Storm Fleet Pyromancer
cards.text: Raid — When Storm Fleet Pyromancer enters the battlefield, if you attacked with a creature this turn, Storm Fleet Pyromancer deals 2 damage to any target.

rulings.text: Raid abilities care only that you attacked with a creature. It doesn't matter how many creatures you attacked with, or which opponent or planeswalker controlled by an opponent those creatures attacked.

Raid abilities evaluate the entire turn to see if you attacked with a creature. That creature doesn't have to still be on the battlefield. Similarly, the player or planeswalker it attacked doesn't have to still be in the game or on the battlefield, respectively.

foreignNames.name: Pyromancienne de la Flotte de la tempête

cards.originalText: Raid — When Storm Fleet Pyromancer enters the battlefield, if you attacked with a creature this turn, Storm Fleet Pyromancer deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Sun-Crowned Hunters
cards.text: Enrage — Whenever Sun-Crowned Hunters is dealt damage, it deals 3 damage to target opponent or planeswalker.
cards.flavor: One alone is dangerous, and they are never alone.

rulings.text: If your life total is brought to 0 or less at the same time that Sun-Crowned Hunters is dealt damage, you lose the game before its enrage ability resolves.
If multiple sources deal damage to a creature with an enrage ability at the same time, most likely because multiple creatures blocked that creature, the enrage ability triggers only once.

If lethal damage is dealt to a creature with an enrage ability, that ability triggers. The creature with that enrage ability leaves the battlefield before that ability resolves, so it won't be affected by the resolving ability.

cards.originalText: Enrage — Whenever Sun-Crowned Hunters is dealt damage, it deals 3 damage to target opponent.

cards.name: Sunbird's Invocation
cards.text: Whenever you cast a spell from your hand, reveal the top X cards of your library, where X is that spell's converted mana cost. You may cast a card revealed this way with converted mana cost X or less without paying its mana cost. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order.

rulings.text: Casting Sunbird's Invocation won't cause its own ability to trigger.

The ability of Sunbird's Invocation resolves before the spell that caused it to trigger. It will resolve even if that spell is countered. If you cast a spell as part of the resolution of the ability, that spell resolves before the spell that caused the ability to trigger.
For spells with {X} in their mana costs, use the value chosen for X to determine the spell's converted mana cost.
If the spell's converted mana cost is 0, you do nothing as the ability of Sunbird's Invocation resolves.
If a revealed card in your library has {X} in its mana cost, you must choose 0 as the value of X when casting it without paying its mana cost.

If you cast one of the revealed cards, you do so as part of the resolution of the triggered ability. You can't wait to cast it later in the turn. Timing permissions based on the card's type are ignored, but other restrictions (such as "Cast [this card] only during combat") are not.

If you cast a card "without paying its mana cost," you can't pay any alternative costs. You can, however, pay additional costs. If the card has any mandatory additional costs, such as that of Costly Plunder, those must be paid to cast the card.

The converted mana cost of a split card, such as cards with aftermath from the Amonkhet block, is based on the combined mana cost of its two halves. The converted mana cost of the resulting spell is based only on the half you cast.

cards.originalText: Whenever you cast a spell from your hand, reveal the top X cards of your library, where X is that spell's converted mana cost. You may cast a card revealed this way with converted mana cost X or less without paying its mana cost. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order.

cards.name: Sure Strike
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn. (It deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
cards.flavor: "Everyone has a weak spot."
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +3/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.

cards.name: Swashbuckling
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has haste.
cards.flavor: The pirates of the Brazen Coalition are the descendants of those displaced by the Legion of Dusk, and they are eager for vengeance.
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has haste.

cards.name: Thrash of Raptors
cards.text: As long as you control another Dinosaur, Thrash of Raptors gets +2/+0 and has trample.
cards.flavor: They glide through the undergrowth, drawn to sounds of disturbance. They attack in unison and all share in the kill. And then they move on.
cards.originalText: As long as you control another Dinosaur, Thrash of Raptors gets +2/+0 and has trample.

cards.name: Tilonalli's Knight
cards.text: Whenever Tilonalli's Knight attacks, if you control a Dinosaur, Tilonalli's Knight gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The people of the Sun Empire worship the sun in three aspects. Tilonalli is the Burning Sun, associated with ferocity, fire, and passion.

rulings.text: If you don't control a Dinosaur as Tilonalli's Knight attacks, its ability won't trigger at all. If you don't control a Dinosaur as the ability of Tilonalli's Knight resolves, that ability has no effect.

Once the ability of Tilonalli's Knight resolves while you control one or more Dinosaurs, Tilonalli's Knight gets +1/+1 for the rest of the turn even if you no longer control a Dinosaur later in the turn.

cards.originalText: Whenever Tilonalli's Knight attacks, if you control a Dinosaur, Tilonalli's Knight gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Tilonalli's Skinshifter
cards.text:
Haste
Whenever Tilonalli's Skinshifter attacks, it becomes a copy of another target nonlegendary attacking creature until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "I am the ferocity of the Burning Sun. I am hide and feather, fang and claw."

rulings.text: If the target of the ability of Tilonalli's Skinshifter becomes an illegal target, Tilonalli's Skinshifter won't become a copy of anything. It will remain a 0/1 attacking creature.

Tilonalli's Skinshifter copies the printed values of the target creature, plus any copy effects that have been applied to it. It won't copy counters on that creature or effects that have changed its power, toughness, types, color, or so on.
Notably, Tilonalli's Skinshifter won't copy effects that make a noncreature permanent become a creature. If this causes Tilonalli's Skinshifter to stop being a creature, it's removed from combat.
If Tilonalli's Skinshifter copies a creature that's copying something else, it will become whatever the target is copying.

If an effect from a resolving spell or ability, such as that of Rallying Roar, begins to apply to Tilonalli's Skinshifter before it becomes a copy of another creature, that effect will continue to apply.
Because attackers have already been declared, any abilities Tilonalli's Skinshifter copies that trigger when it or other creatures attack won't trigger.
Once the ability of Tilonalli's Skinshifter resolves, its new characteristics don't change if the characteristics of the copied creature change or if the copied creature leaves the battlefield.
Tilonalli's Skinshifter remains a copy of the creature through the end step. Damage is removed from it at the same time that it stops being a copy.

foreignNames.name: ティロナーリの肌変わり

cards.originalText:
Haste
Whenever Tilonalli's Skinshifter attacks, it becomes a copy of another target nonlegendary attacking creature until end of turn.

cards.name: Trove of Temptation
cards.text:
Each opponent must attack you or a planeswalker you control with at least one creature each combat if able.
At the beginning of your end step, create a colorless Treasure artifact token with "{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color."

rulings.text: Each opponent only has to attack you or a planeswalker you control with one creature total, not one creature for you and one for each planeswalker you control. Other creatures are free to attack other players or other planeswalkers, or to not attack at all.

If a creature isn't able to attack you or a planeswalker you control for any reason (such as being tapped as its controller's declare attackers step begins or being affected by "summoning sickness"), that creature doesn't have to attack. If no creatures a player controls are able to attack you or a planeswalker you control, Trove of Temptation's requirement has no effect during that combat. If there's a cost associated with having a creature attack, its controller isn't forced to pay that cost, so it doesn't have to attack in that case either.

In a Two-Headed Giant game, each of your two opponents must attack you or a planeswalker you control with at least one creature if able. Attacking your teammate or a planeswalker your teammate controls doesn't satisfy Trove of Temptation's requirement.

cards.originalText:
Each opponent must attack you or a planeswalker you control with at least one creature each combat if able.
At the beginning of your end step, create a colorless Treasure artifact token with "{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool."

cards.name: Unfriendly Fire
cards.text: Unfriendly Fire deals 4 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: Disputes within the Brazen Coalition can escalate from insult to broadside in the blink of an eye.
cards.originalText: Unfriendly Fire deals 4 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Vance's Blasting Cannons
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, exile the top card of your library. If it's a nonland card, you may cast that card this turn.
Whenever you cast your third spell in a turn, you may transform Vance's Blasting Cannons.
cards.flavor: With a broadside assault, Captain Vance carved the cliffs to form her new home.

rulings.text: The card exiled by the first ability of Vance's Blasting Cannons is exiled face up.

Casting the exiled card follows the normal rules for casting that card. You must pay its costs, and you must follow all applicable timing rules. For example, if you exile a creature card this way, you must wait until your main phase to cast it.
If you don't cast the exiled card, it remains in exile.
The second ability of Vance's Blasting Cannons resolves before the spell that caused it to trigger. The ability will resolve even if that spell is countered.

The second ability of Vance's Blasting Cannons counts all the spells you've cast, including Vance's Blasting Cannons itself if you cast it this turn. The ability won't trigger unless Vance's Blasting Cannons is on the battlefield as you cast your third spell of the turn.
For more information on double-faced cards, see the Ixalan mechanics article (http://magic.wizards.com/en/articles/archive/feature/ixalan-mechanics).

cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, exile the top card of your library. If it's a nonland card, you may cast that card this turn.
Whenever you cast your third spell in a turn, you may transform Vance's Blasting Cannons.

cards.name: Spitfire Bastion
cards.text:
(Transforms from Vance's Blasting Cannons.)
{T}: Add {R}.
{2}{R}, {T}: Spitfire Bastion deals 3 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: Now instead of a ship, Ripley Vance commands a fortress.
cards.originalText:
(Transforms from Vance's Blasting Cannons.)
{T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.
{2}{R}, {T}: Spitfire Bastion deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Wily Goblin
cards.text: When Wily Goblin enters the battlefield, create a colorless Treasure artifact token with "{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color."
cards.flavor: Goblins climb and swing with ease, whether through a pirate ship's rigging or a tree's branches.
cards.originalText: When Wily Goblin enters the battlefield, create a colorless Treasure artifact token with "{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool."

cards.name: Ancient Brontodon
cards.flavor: It is taller than all but the tallest trees, and older than all but the oldest.

cards.name: Atzocan Archer
cards.text:
Reach
When Atzocan Archer enters the battlefield, you may have it fight another target creature. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)
cards.flavor: His arrows are fletched with feathers from the greatest of the winged dinosaurs.

rulings.text: You must choose another target creature (if able) as Atzocan Archer's triggered ability is put on the stack. You choose as that ability resolves whether those creatures fight.
If Atzocan Archer isn't on the battlefield as its triggered ability resolves, or if the target of that ability is illegal, no creature will deal or be dealt damage.
Atzocan Archer's ability can target another creature you control (such as a Dinosaur with an enrage ability).

cards.originalText:
Reach
When Atzocan Archer enters the battlefield, you may have it fight another target creature. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)

cards.name: Blinding Fog
cards.text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to creatures this turn. Creatures you control gain hexproof until end of turn. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
cards.flavor: "I see you, shiny soldiers, but you won't see me."

rulings.text: Blinding Fog prevents all damage that would be dealt to creatures, not just combat damage.
Damage that would be dealt to creatures that enter the battlefield later in the turn will also be prevented. However, creatures that come under your control later in the turn won't gain hexproof.

cards.originalText: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to creatures this turn. Creatures you control gain hexproof until end of turn. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

cards.name: Blossom Dryad
cards.text: {T}: Untap target land.
cards.flavor: The only force on Ixalan not interested in finding the golden city is Ixalan itself.
cards.originalText: {T}: Untap target land.

cards.name: Carnage Tyrant
cards.text:
This spell can't be countered.
Trample, hexproof
cards.flavor: Sun Empire commanders are well versed in advanced martial strategy. Still, the correct maneuver is usually to deploy the giant, implacable death lizard.
cards.originalText:
Carnage Tyrant can't be countered.
Trample, hexproof

cards.name: Colossal Dreadmaw
cards.text: Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
cards.flavor: If you feel the ground quake, run. If you hear its bellow, flee. If you see its teeth, it's too late.
cards.originalText: Trample

cards.name: Commune with Dinosaurs
cards.text: Look at the top five cards of your library. You may reveal a Dinosaur or land card from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

rulings.text: If an effect refers to a "[subtype] spell" or "[subtype] card," it refers only to a spell or card that has that subtype. For example, March of the Drowned is a card that benefits Pirates and features Pirates in its illustration, but it isn't a Pirate card.

cards.originalText: Look at the top five cards of your library. You may reveal a Dinosaur or land card from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.name: Crash the Ramparts
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The Legion's conquistadors could endure Ixalan's sun. Their forts could withstand a charging ceratops. But nothing can stop a ceratops strengthened by the sun.
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains trample until end of turn.

cards.name: Crushing Canopy
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Destroy target creature with flying.
• Destroy target enchantment.
cards.flavor:
"Do not mistake your lofty vantage point for safety."
—Shaper Tuvasa
cards.originalText:
Choose one —
• Destroy target creature with flying.
• Destroy target enchantment.

cards.name: Deathgorge Scavenger
cards.text: Whenever Deathgorge Scavenger enters the battlefield or attacks, you may exile target card from a graveyard. If a creature card is exiled this way, you gain 2 life. If a noncreature card is exiled this way, Deathgorge Scavenger gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

rulings.text: There's no way to get both bonuses at once while Deathgorge Scavenger's ability is resolving. If an artifact creature card is exiled this way, it's a creature card and not a noncreature card.

cards.originalText: Whenever Deathgorge Scavenger enters the battlefield or attacks, you may exile target card from a graveyard. If a creature card is exiled this way, you gain 2 life. If a noncreature card is exiled this way, Deathgorge Scavenger gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Deeproot Champion
cards.text: Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, put a +1/+1 counter on Deeproot Champion.
cards.flavor: "No good will come from what you seek. Turn back now or suffer an ignoble death far from your home."

rulings.text: Deeproot Champion's ability resolves before the spell that caused it to trigger.

cards.originalText: Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, put a +1/+1 counter on Deeproot Champion.

cards.name: Deeproot Warrior
cards.text: Whenever Deeproot Warrior becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"We breathe from our soul and bones to give strength to the jungle. The jungle breathes from its roots and rivers to give strength to us."
—Shaper Falani

rulings.text: Deeproot Warrior's ability triggers only once if multiple creatures block it.

cards.originalText: Whenever Deeproot Warrior becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Drover of the Mighty
cards.text:
Drover of the Mighty gets +2/+2 as long as you control a Dinosaur.
{T}: Add one mana of any color.
cards.flavor: "I do not lead. They do not follow. We walk together."

rulings.text: Because damage remains marked on a creature until it's removed as the turn ends, the damage Drover of the Mighty takes during combat may become lethal if you no longer control a Dinosaur later in the turn.

cards.originalText:
Drover of the Mighty gets +2/+2 as long as you control a Dinosaur.
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Emergent Growth
cards.text: Target creature gets +5/+5 until end of turn and must be blocked this turn if able.
cards.flavor: "By accepting my smallness I am vast."

rulings.text: If the target creature attacks, the defending player must assign at least one blocker to it during the declare blockers step if that player controls any creatures that could block it. Other creatures may also block it, block other creatures, or not block at all.

cards.originalText: Target creature gets +5/+5 until end of turn and must be blocked this turn if able.

cards.name: Emperor's Vanguard
cards.text: Whenever Emperor's Vanguard deals combat damage to a player, it explores. (Reveal the top card of your library. Put that card into your hand if it's a land. Otherwise, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature, then put the card back or put it into your graveyard.)

rulings.text: Once an ability that causes a creature to explore begins to resolve, no player may take any other actions until it's done. Notably, opponents can't try to remove the exploring creature after you reveal a nonland card but before it receives a counter.
If no card is revealed, most likely because that player's library is empty, the exploring creature receives a +1/+1 counter.

If a resolving spell or ability instructs a specific creature to explore but that creature has left the battlefield, the creature still explores. If you reveal a nonland card this way, you won't put a +1/+1 counter on anything, but you may put the revealed card into your graveyard. Effects that trigger "whenever a creature you control explores" trigger if appropriate.

cards.originalText: Whenever Emperor's Vanguard deals combat damage to a player, it explores. (Reveal the top card of your library. Put that card into your hand if it's a land. Otherwise, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature, then put the card back or put it into your graveyard.)

cards.name: Grazing Whiptail
cards.text: Reach
cards.flavor: Often found browsing on the upper canopies of Ixalan's jungles, whiptails are known to absently bat away anything foolish enough to interrupt their meal.
cards.originalText: Reach

cards.name: Growing Rites of Itlimoc
cards.text:
When Growing Rites of Itlimoc enters the battlefield, look at the top four cards of your library. You may reveal a creature card from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
At the beginning of your end step, if you control four or more creatures, transform Growing Rites of Itlimoc.

rulings.text: The last ability of Growing Rites of Itlimoc doesn't trigger if you don't control four or more creatures as your end step begins. If you don't control four or more creatures as it resolves, it does nothing.

If you control a creature that will be removed from the battlefield "at the beginning of the next end step," you can resolve the ability of Growing Rites of Itlimoc before that creature leaves the battlefield.

If you gain control of a creature "until end of turn," or if a noncreature permanent you control becomes a creature "until end of turn," it'll be a creature under your control through the entire end step.
For more information on double-faced cards, see the Ixalan mechanics article (http://magic.wizards.com/en/articles/archive/feature/ixalan-mechanics).

foreignNames.name: イトリモクの成長儀式

cards.originalText:
When Growing Rites of Itlimoc enters the battlefield, look at the top four cards of your library. You may reveal a creature card from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
At the beginning of your end step, if you control four or more creatures, transform Growing Rites of Itlimoc.

cards.name: Itlimoc, Cradle of the Sun
cards.text:
(Transforms from Growing Rites of Itlimoc.)
{T}: Add {G}.
{T}: Add {G} for each creature you control.
cards.flavor: Before the Sun Empire was born, humans and merfolk joined their magic to invoke a blessing of fertility on the land.

cards.originalText:
(Transforms from Growing Rites of Itlimoc.)
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool for each creature you control.

cards.name: Ixalli's Diviner
cards.text: When Ixalli's Diviner enters the battlefield, it explores. (Reveal the top card of your library. Put that card into your hand if it's a land. Otherwise, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature, then put the card back or put it into your graveyard.)

If no card is revealed, most likely because that player's library is empty, the exploring creature receives a +1/+1 counter.

If a resolving spell or ability instructs a specific creature to explore but that creature has left the battlefield, the creature still explores. If you reveal a nonland card this way, you won't put a +1/+1 counter on anything, but you may put the revealed card into your graveyard. Effects that trigger "whenever a creature you control explores" trigger if appropriate.

cards.name: Ixalli's Keeper
cards.text: {7}{G}, {T}, Sacrifice Ixalli's Keeper: Target creature gets +5/+5 and gains trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The people of the Sun Empire worship the sun in three aspects. Ixalli is the Verdant Sun, who fosters growth in all things.
cards.originalText: {7}{G}, {T}, Sacrifice Ixalli's Keeper: Target creature gets +5/+5 and gains trample until end of turn.

cards.name: Jade Guardian
cards.text:
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
When Jade Guardian enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on target Merfolk you control.
cards.flavor: The River Heralds believe that jade gives weight to their magic.

rulings.text: Jade Guardian can be the target of its own ability.

cards.originalText:
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
When Jade Guardian enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on target Merfolk you control.
